name: The Hay-Adams

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is so elegant and has such personal service, you feel like youre coming home every time you walk in. The reception and concierge service are very good. Our room was perfect and the location is a stones throw from the White House. All in all a wonderful stay.
reviews.title: Elegance at a good price.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hay-Adams as a family this summer. The hotel is beautiful and elegant, yet very family friendly. Our room was a knock out and extremely comfy. The view of the White House from our window was spectacular. The location was terrific and fairly close to everything we could want on this trip. We enjoyed both restaurants and they went out of their way for the kids to ensure they enjoyed their meals as well. The concierge service was extraordinary from the moment we were booked months ago. They worked with us to not only plan our daily schedule but arranged all tour tickets and yes their was a small fee for the courier that waited for the tickets daily, but worth it! After each very long day in 100 degree heat of touring, to come back to such a beautiful place and have a lovely meal was very nice.
reviews.title: Fantastic and family friendly

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for five nights during my time in Washington DC and was absolutely blown away by the time I spent here. Everything was done to perfection
reviews.title: Amazing hotel -once in a lifetime experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room I stayed in was breathtaking - easily one of the most amazingly wonderful hotel rooms I have stayed in. It was a unique combination of beauty, elegance and grandeur and a homely down-to-earth comfort which made you feel relaxed and welcome. All the furnishings in the room were very beautifully and immaculately designed (the lovely bed deserves particular mention in terms of its elegant design, beautiful linen and the curtains that enveloped it) and the lighting was fitted in such a way as to really make the room look spectacular when illuminated. No amenity or luxury was lacking and the contents of the mini-bar were absolutely amazing -lots of delicious sweets, cookies, chocolates and jellybeans as well as a wide variety of beverages. I have never seen a mini-bar like it. The bathroom was also beautifully designed and had all the toiletries that you could possibly want.
reviews.title: Great views of the White House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was exceptional. Of particular note was the receptionist who checked me out -who seemed to be coping with 200 different things at once and yet managed to complete each task very diligently while making everyone she was dealing with feel unique and special. The hotel doorman was amazing -he was able to assist me greatly in navigating Washington and was warm and friendly throughout my stay. The concierge service was also great. The housekeeping staff were polite, friendly and helpful to a fault and the nice lady to came in every night to give me the next day's weather report and chocolates was an absolute gem
reviews.title: Incredible Experience At The Hay-Adams!!! The Pinnacle of Service and DC Style!

reviews.text: Stayed there for a few nights end of September 2011. The cost was prohibitive even for a small room (and no view of the White House for me) but it was still nice. Lots of free things: complimentary shoe shine, free newspapers (national and foreign), free wifi, free local telephone calls, free business centre- open 24 hours a day- it’s like having your office with you. Very practical: the overnight pressing service to take care of your crumpled suits (alternative: the ironing board in the wardrobe for the cost conscious). Turndown service includes filling of the ice bucket and tuning the Bose radio/CD player to your favorite station. Bathroom is well-stocked, with plush towels and toiletries by Asprey- bathrobe is a bit cheap-looking (microfiber on the outside/cotton on the inside). TV could be better: a bit cumbersome to use and the choice of non-US channels is limited (no BBC, no German, no French). Good breakfast in the downstairs restaurant- and it is a la carte only- no need to get up for anything. If there is a problem that needs taken care of: mumble a few incoherent words to the concierge (that’s what I did) and consider it done. Staff is wonderful and makes you feel at home. Great for people watching if you are interested in Wall Street celebrities, Black Amex card holders and ladies who lunch
reviews.title: Oasis of civility and friendliness

reviews.text: You can't beat the location, if your destination is downtown DC or the White House. The staff seems well-trained and seems to execute at a very high level. The room I received fronted 16th Street and looked out upon the "Church of the Presidents" across the street. The lobby is very well-maintained with lots of wood. The style is more traditional or classic, rather than contemporary/trendy. Our group paid $335/night on a discounted basis, and I understand the week we stayed was a rather high-volume, high-demand one for DC hotels; the rack rates for the Hay-Adams for this week began at $525. The bed in particular was very, very comfortable, and I was also pleased with the general volume of space in my room, the size of the closets, and the size and lighting in the bathroom. The bathroom amenities were very nice. Nightly turn-down service and a Bose radio on the desk, and also a large TV and well-stocked minibar. My only non-satisfactions were with the overnight complimentary shoe-shine service (they delivered my shoes very late), newspaper delivery (also fairly late), and the breakfast I enjoyed with business associates was very expensive yet was not very substantial nor remarkable in quality.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for--which, here, is almost everything.

reviews.text: The Hay-Adams has an old-fashioned, luxurious English feel. The staff were friendly and accommodating, and the style in the room is relaxing and comfortable. The room service food was very excellent: fresh, delicious, and prompt. They couldn't make an iced cafe latte, and the bathroom periodically smelled strongly of cigarettes (vents from an adjacent room?), but one cannot quibble. They were also remarkably kind to our children.
reviews.title: Very comfortable, friendly

reviews.text: I had an emergency family trip during a very busy weekend in DC so I stayed at the Hay-Adams even though it was more than I usually spend. Everything about the experience was worth it! The staff from the doorman to the reception staff were amazingly wonderful. Their promotional materials say "the only thing we overlook is the White House" and this is not hyperbole. Easy walk to the White House and Smithsonian locations. GREAT bar is located in the basement. As a woman alone I felt perfectly safe and comfortable having a nightcap.
reviews.title: Best Location in DC

reviews.text: Absolutely the best hotel with wonderful people who are friendly, helpful and make you feel that you own the place.
reviews.title: THE BEST!!!!

reviews.text: Quite possibly the nicest hotel in the best location you could ever find! I stayed there in July of 2009, it was my first time in D.C. and now, I could never stay anyplace else! The location, the service, the rooms, the building, all as good as it gets! The staff was amazingly nice and accomodating. The room was so tasteful and elegant! HUGE! An experience I'll never forget! Thanks
reviews.title: WOW!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Obviously a great location, I've stayed here a few times on business, and always had a good experience. We had a group dinner in the room near the bar with a view of the White House. Nice rooms, not very large (it is an old hotel after all), but elegantly appointed. Because of the size and configuration of the Hay-Adams, you don't really get large convention or seminar type groups, and thus the hotel vibe is calm and relaxing. Nice (semi-famous) downstairs bar, very helpful front desk. Highly recommended for solo business trips.
reviews.title: Calm and elegant

reviews.text: I stayed here last winter (late January 2011) on business, in one of the top floor rooms with a full-on view of the white house. I have to say, the view was stunning and the room was very pretty. However, something was wrong with the heating in my room, and it was about 85 degrees. It was really unbearable. They sent up an engineer to fix it, but it made no difference. I ended up having to sleep with the window open in the dead of winter -- not a very relaxing way to end a long day of meetings.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with heating problem

reviews.text: This hotel has a perfect location next to The White House. The staff was very welcoming and the service was great. Our room was clean, big and had 2 lovely beds with a lots of soft pillows and down comforters. The bathroom was small, but had everything we needed. The restaurant serves very good a la carte breakfast. Our stay was a little bit expensive, but it is one of the best hotels I have stayed at!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel next to The White House

reviews.text: It was our last hotel stay in the USA before travelling back home to Italy, and one of our best memories! Everyone was so kind and helpful and really made us feel special! Let alone the very special location...simply amazing!
reviews.title: best location and customer service in Washington DC

reviews.text: Beautiful interior, great service and perfect location. 5 stars.
reviews.title: Gorgeous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free WIFI!
reviews.title: The Best Hotel Stay Ever!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was my husband's birthday and Hurricane Irene decided to join us. Ever wondered what happened to customer service, it resides at the Hay Adams in Washington DC. The concierge's entire team was Excellent, but Eric and Anna (Manager) were the best.. Anna made the best dinner recommendation and Eric arranged for a special birthday celebration dinner since we had to cancel our dinner reservation due to the weather. The chef baked my husband a Special B-day cake. The breakfast was second to none the team was excellent. Giovanni you are Excellent, Anthony (bar) Perfect - Michell (Bartendar) Great. The Bar/rest Manager and the servers WOW, talk about excellent servers. I hate that I can't remember the server's name for dinner in the Bar because he was Perfection!! I left some jewelry in my rooom & HSKP gave it to Willie (Security) who sent it to my home within 24hrs. WOW. I love this place. Room SVC and the room was AMAZING!!! Everyone seemed to know it was my husband's birthday and took care to wish him well. The Bell staff, WOW!!
reviews.title: A charming experience. Service from another era.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone at this hotel has a personal, warm and friendly attitude. The staff is very attentive and REAL. The Hay Adams isn't exactly a small hotel, but it feels like you're staying at one. I thought there would be a tinge of pretense and snootiness in the air but I found none.
reviews.title: The Place to Stay in Washington

reviews.text: The location is the best in DC. Our room had a window that opened all the way and overlooked the White House and Washington Monument, which at night when lit up looked spectacular and even surreal to look at. The view truly is unforgettable and no other hotel in DC can match that.
reviews.title: Great but not the best

description: Welcome to Washington's landmark residence of choice for visitors to our nation's capital. The Hay-Adams, a luxury boutique hotel, is as close as you can get to staying at the White House without a personal invitation from the President. Originally designed in the 1920s as a residential hotel, The Hay-Adams carefully emulates the ambiance of a distinguished private mansion on Lafayette Square. The 145-room boutique hotel in Washington, DC features 21 luxury suites with stunning views of Lafayette Park and the White House. All of our guest rooms exhibit the perfect combination of heritage, luxury, contemporary comfort and technology. Ideally situated in Lafayette Square and steps away from many of Washington D.C.'s famous attractions, The Hay-Adams is the premier destination for leisure and business travelers alike.
